result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlene J Phelps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $1,688.26 is ordered to be paid to Roundy's Corporation as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Work towards GED or HSED.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the Pick N Save store listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: One Letter from the Defendant and One Character Letter, received and filed incourt.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Arlene J Phelps in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Counts 3 & 4 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
3 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Concurrent on:  Count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
To work toward her GED or HSED.
No contact with:  Pick'N'Save listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.

RESTITUTION:  $1, 688.26 (to be paid to Roundy's Corp. to be paid before costs/fines).
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  





Count 2:
3 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Consecutive to: count 1.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as Count 1.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Arlene J Phelps in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  
Atty. Sonderhouse was just appointed - Needs to get the discovery and pre-trial offer from the prior attorney.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
for Substitution of Attorneys signed and filed.
Stipulation and Order for substitution of attorney received by Attorney Sonderhouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Arlene J Phelps in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.
